CatDescriptText: Mrs. Jasper Leonard, 2230 Midtown Square, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 12, 1958, pg. A1 with question: �Do you think that the Pittsburgh Railways Company is justified in asking an increase in trolley fares?� answer reads: �No because the people are not making enough money. They can�t live now.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Jasper Leonard, wearing eyeglasses, light colored button down textured coat with collar and cuffs, and light colored patterned head scarf, holding dark handbag and umbrella, standing in front of light colored concrete wall with stone wainscot, left store window displaying cigars with sign inscribed "for your contentment stop here for Dutch Masters," right store window displaying pyjamas
